intro: Blepharoglossum merapiense, commonly known as the Merapi fern, is a species of epiphytic fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or branches in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are bi-lobed and have a distinctive, intricate vein pattern. It plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitats by contributing to forest biodiversity.
